name: Romesco Sauce
keywords: Romesco Sauce, Sauce, Italian, Easy, Capsicum, Nutty, Tomato, Spicy, Almond Butter
description: Incredibly versatile delightfully nutty sauce with a bit of a kick.
recipeIngredient: 400g tin Tomato or just diced fresh Tomatoes
Smidge of Chili/Cayenne for some kick

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 180C. In a large baking tray lay down a single layer of the tomatoes, capsicum, and garlic. Coat everything nicely with olive oil and toss to ensure even coating all over. Bake for about 40-60 minutes to ensure you get some nice roasty bits.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep and Bake

recipeInstructions.text: Add everything to a pot. Mix everything together, add about 100-200ml of water to make it easier to mix and then whiz with a stick blender.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix in pot

recipeInstructions.text: Whizz with a stick blender until it gets super smooth. For ultimate smoothness, skin the capsicum and tomatoes before adding to the pot. Season with salt and pepper as desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer back to your baking tray. Bake again for 15-20 mins. This will result in a nice thick roasty sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Roast

notes: I like to have it with roast pork/pork belly or some sourdough bread. Also great with crispy chorizo bits and pasta but I would recommend skipping the last step to keep it more saucy to make it easier to coat the pasta, or you can just add back some water.
Can add fresh chili to the roasting tray for a nice kick and extra flavor.
Easy to make in bulk and then store in the freezer for later use.
